A company based in Thailand, PTT, is planning to build a plant that converts natural gas that would come in by pipeline to plastic pellets.
The process breaks down molecules of ethane or cracks them, so it's called a cracker plant.
When PTT gives the final go ahead, new jobs will start coming.
About a four- to four-and-a-half-year build with thousands of construction jobs throughout that entire time period - thousands.
Then five or six hundred jobs at the cracker plant itself.
And then, if all goes right, other factories with more jobs will go up nearby.
And we've already had a dozen to 15 calls from companies asking for land and/or buildings.
Companies that use plastic, like a regional dairy that uses plastic milk jugs that are made at a plant in Nebraska.
In talking with one of the owners about a month ago, he said, if the plant comes here, we would be able to cut our plastics costs that include the shipping by 65 to 75 percent.
